Package cmu.edu.andrew.spoonacular

Class Ingredient

java.lang.Object
cmu.edu.andrew.spoonacular.Ingredient
public final class Ingredient
extends java.lang.Object
An immmutable ingredient type used in a recipe.

An Ingredient cannot be constructed; it is returned by the API for methods that require ingredients, like the ingredients in a recipe by Recipe::ingredients. An ingredient instance represents a type of food item used in a recipe.

The class has four accessors and a toString method. Users can get the name of the ingredient, the price of the ingredient, and the nutrients in the ingredient.

  • Method Details

    • name

      public java.lang.String name()
      Returns the name of the ingredient.
      Returns:
      the name of the ingredient.

    • priceInCents

      public int priceInCents​(double quantity, Amount.Unit unit)
      Returns an approximate cost to purchase a specified amount of the ingredient in US cents. The amount is given as a quantity with a unit.
      Parameters:
      quantity - The quantity of this ingredient that you want the price for.
      unit - The unit of the quantity.
      Returns:
      an approximate cost to purchase a specified amount of the ingredient in US cents.
      Throws:
      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if there is no known conversion for this ingredient to the input unit.

    • nutrients

      public java.util.Map<Nutrient,​Amount> nutrients​(double quantity, Amount.Unit unit)
      Returns a map that stores the amount of a given Nutrient in this Ingredient. The amount of the ingredient is passed in as input.
      Parameters:
      quantity - The quantity of this ingredient that you want the nutritional info for.
      unit - The unit of the quantity.
      Returns:
      an approximate cost to purchase a specified amount of the ingredient in US cents.
      Throws:
      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if there is no known conversion for this ingredient to the input unit.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this Ingredient. The form of the string is: "{name}".
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this Ingredient.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Tests equality of an Object to this Ingredient. Returns true if the object is an Ingredient and has the same spoonacular id as this Ingredient, false otherwise.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:

      Returns:
